caption.p: MENA region medicinal plants with antimycobacterial activity.

tr.th: Part used: Preparation Extract / Active Compound

tr.td: The methanol extract of leaf exhibited activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC of >500 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
Colds, cough ( P Singh et al., 2011, Santhosh and Suriyanarayanan, 2014).
Ethanol extract of plant showed activity at 200 mg/ml concentration and growth MTB 20 colonies in 4 week incubation ( Abbas, 2011).
The crude plant extract was active at 200 mg/ml concentration and showed no growth MTB ( Abbas, 2011)
At 200 mg/ml, the plant crude extract showed activity against MTB and 3 colonies presented after 4 week incubation time ( Abbas, 2011).
The methanol extract of leaf exhibited activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC of >500 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
Methanol extract of leaf plant showed inhibition against M. bovis BCG at MIC of >500 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
Antibacterial, insecticides( Bandara et al., 2010, Kareru et al., 2010)
The extract inhibit cell growth activity at 1 mg/mL concentration by time kill 95% in 1 week and 60 mm inhibition zone by disk diffusion method ( Arjomandzadegan et al., 2016).
The extract was active against M. bovis BCG at MIC 250 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
The ethanol crude extract exhibited activity against growth H37Rv strain at concentrations 100 µg/ml with MIC 6% ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The plant crude extract showed activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
Local food & plants in Europe ( Heinrich et al., 2016).
At 100 µg/ml of the ethanol extract showed 21% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Crude plant extract was active against growth of H37Rv strain at 100 µg/ml with MIC 35% ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The methanol flower extract was active against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
Arial ethanol plant extract showed activity against growth of H37Rv strain at concentrations >100 µg/ml with MIC 8% ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Root: maceration by ethanol extracts 70%, fractionation by with petroleum ether, chloroform, methanol and water/Alantolactone

The crude ethanol extract exhibited activity against H37Rv strain at MIC < 100 µg/ml with MIC 100% Inhibition activity. The fractionation and isolation compound have been screening against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and showed activity at MICs 3.125 µg/ml ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The plant crude extract showed activity against H37Rv at concentrations >100 µg/ml with MIC 6% ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Methanol extracts of plant showed activity against the M. phlei, M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv with MIC 1.95, 6.25 and 7.8 mg/ml & DIZ 27,29 and17 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The root plant extracts showed activity against M. phlei, M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv with MIC 15.6, 25 and 62.5 mg/ml & DIZ 15.5, 25 and 13 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The extract exhibited activity against H37Rv at concentrations >100 µg/ml with MIC 22% ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Leaves, stem and flower: hydro-distillation water
At 640 µg/ml, the oil plant parts extract showed activity against H37RV and MTB sensitive isolates and observed 58.1% inhibition percentage ( Hozoorbakhsh et al., 2016).
Methanol flower extract exhibited activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
The flower extract showed activity at MIC > 500 µg/mL against M. bovis BCG ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
The crude extract was active against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 µg/mL ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
At 100 µg/ml, crude plant extract exhibited 95% inhibition activity against growth of H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Leaf, bark and root: sonication dichloromethane, ethyl acetate and ethanol (10 mg/ml)
The plant parts extract exhibited strong activity against Mycobacterium aurum A + ( Eldeen and Van Staden, 2008).
Headache& cough ( Al-Thobaiti and Abu Zeid, 2018).
Branches, leaves and flowers : ethanol extracts 70%
All the parts ethanol extraction showed activity against H37Rv at concentration 100 µg/ml with 49% Inhibition percentage ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Leaf, bark: sonication dichloromethane, ethyl acetate and ethanol (10 mg/ml)
The plant parts extract exhibited activity against Mycobacterium aurum A + at different concentration ( Eldeen and Van Staden, 2008).
Skin fungal infections ( Saini et al., 2009)
At 100 µg/ml, the ethanol plant extract showed 35% inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The crude extract exhibited activity against H37Rv at 100 µg/ml with inhibition growth 18% ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The crude extract exhibited Inhibition against H37Rv at concentrations 100 µg/ml with 65% inhibition growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Colds, coughs and fever ( Kitessa et al., 2011).
The plant extract exhibited activity against growth of H37Rv strain at concentrations 100 µg/mL with MIC 37% inhibition growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 µg/ml, the ethanol extract showed 4% & 85% inhibition against growth of H37Rv strain, respectively ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Cough and treat wounds ( Muthu et al., 2006, Roy, 2015).
The crude extracts was activate against the M. phlei M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv at MIC 40, 10 and7.8 mg/ml & DIZ 26, 22 and 17 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
Cough, wound healing ( Al-Harbi et al., 2016, Safwat et al., 2018).
The ethanol extract at concentration of 100 µg/ml showed 14% inhibition against H37Rv strain ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Alyssum fulvescens Sibth. et Sm. var. fulvescens
At 100 µg/ml, the ethanol extract showed anti-TB activity against H37Rv with 1% inhibition growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 µg/ml, the ethanol extract showed activity against H37Rv with 13% inhibition growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The ethanol plant extract showed activity against H37Rv at 100 µg/ml with 21% inhibition growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 µg/ml, was active against H37Rv strain with 55% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).

Methanol extracts of whole plant showed activity against M. phlei M. smegmatis and M .tuberculosis H37Rv strain with MIC 50, 12.5 and 62.5 mg/ml & DIZ 18, 20 and 12 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The ethanol extract at 200 mg/ml was active with no growth against MTB ( Abbas, 2011).
The crude plant extract exhibited against growth H37Rv at 100 µg/ml with 3% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The extract showed activity against the M. phlei M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv with MIC 31.3, 25 and 125 mg/ml & DIZ 15, 25 and 10 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
Methanol extracts methanol of plant exhibited activity against M. phlei at MIC of 80 mg/ml & DIZ 26 mm ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The aerial ethanol extract at concentrations 100 µg/ml showed 19% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv strain ( Tosun et al., 2005).

hydro-distillation /
1)
Octyl acetate 37.26%
2)
Octyl formate 13.25%
3)
verticilla-4(20),7,11-triene 6.85%
The oils extract with isolated compound (1,2 and 3) all was active against nine clinical isolates and H37Rv of tuberculosis at 15 μl/ml ( Elhassan et al., 2017).
Antibacterial, diarrhea ( Abdoul-latif et al., 2012, Assefa et al., 2012).
The plant crude extract showed activity result against M. bovis at 125.0 μg/ml ( Rahgozar et al., 2018).
Anti-inflammatory ( Krohn et al., 2001, Poeckel and Werz, 2006).
Ethanol extract at 200 mg/ml concentration exhibited activity with no growth against MTB ( Abbas, 2011).
At 25 mg/mL, the methanol extract of the fruit was activate against seven clinical samples & H37Rv strain ( Ehsanifar et al., 2017).
Twigs and root: Sonication dichloromethane, ethyl acetate and ethanol (10 mg/ml)
The plant extract exhibited activity against Mycobacterium aurum A + with (MIC) values Twigs extract 12.5, 25 & 6.25 mg/ml Root extract 25, na & 6.25 mg/ml ( Eldeen and Van Staden, 2008).
At 100 μg/ml, the plant extract showed activity against H37Rv with 24% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The extract at concentrations 100 μg/ml exhibited anti-TB activity against growth H37Rv with 10% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Silene dichotoma Ehrh. subsp. sibthorpiana (Reichb.) Rech
Ethanol extract at 100 μg/ml concentrations showed activity 42% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv strain ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Silene vulgaris (Moench) Garcke var. commutata (Guss.)Coode et Cullen
The crude extract exhibited anti-TB activity against H37Rv at concentrations 100 μg/ml with 30% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The extraction showed activity against H37Rv at concentrations of 100 μg/ml with 81% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 μg/ml, the plant extract showed activity against H37Rv with 34% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Antibacterial, antifungal ( Agnieszka Stępień et al., 2018, Christodoulakis et al., 2014).
Leaf, bark and root: Sonication dichloromethane, ethyl acetate and ethanol (10 mg/ml)
The plant parts extract exhibited activity against Mycobacterium aurum A + at different concentration ( Eldeen and Van Staden, 2008).
At 100 μg/ml, the plant extract showed activity against H37Rv with 69% Inhibition of growth( Tosun et al., 2005).
The extract at concentration of 100 μg/ml exhibited anti-TB activity against growth H37Rv with 21% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Methanol extract of seed showed activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
The crude extract showed activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
At 100 μg/ml, the plant extract showed activity against H37Rv with 4% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).

Whole plant: maceration withPetroleum ether, Chloroform, Ethyl acetate, Methanol and70% methanol /
1)
Quercetin 3-O-glucoside

The plant fractionation by methanol showed activity against the M. phlei M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv with MIC 5.0, 2.5 and 3.12 mg/ml while DIZ 27.7, 28.3 and 18.0 mm respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018). N10 isolated active compound showed activity against the M. phlei M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv with MIC 0.078, 0.312 and 0.15 mg/ml while DIZ 28.5, 25 and 27 mm respectively, with glutamine synthetase enzyme inhibition activity ( Safwat et al., 2018).
Treat asthma, bronchitis. Used as expectorant ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The extract at concentration of 200 mg/ml was active and has no growth against MTB ( Abbas, 2011).
The methanol extract of fruit exhibited activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
At 100 μg/ml, the ethanol extract of plant showed 12% Inhibition growth against H37Rv strain ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The extract at concentrations 100 μg/ml exhibited activity against growth H37Rv with 19% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Ethanol extract of plant showed activity against H37Rv at concentrations of 100 μg/ml with MIC 10% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 μg/ml, the ethanol extract of plant showed activity against M. tuberculosis H37Ra ( Tosun et al., 2004).
The extract showed Inhibit cell growth activity at 1 mg/mL concentration by time kill 95% in 1 week and 60 mm inhibition zone by disk diffusion method ( Arjomandzadegan et al., 2016).
Snake bite, antimicrobial ( Asgarpanah, 2012, Shrivastava and Dwivedi, 2015).
The extract at concentration of 100 μg/ml exhibited activity against growth H37Rv with 30% inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The leaves plant extraction was active at 100 μg/ml and showed 12% inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Methanol extract of herbal exhibited activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
At > 500 μg/mL, the methanol plant extract showed activity against M. bovis BCG ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).

The essential oil extract with bioactive compounds (1 and 2) showed activity against M. tuberculosis H37Ra at MIC 196 µg /mL by MGIT fluorometric test tube ( Aşkun et al., 2010).
The essential oil extract with bioactive compounds (1 and 2) was active against M. tuberculosis H37Ra at MIC 196 µg /mL by MGIT fluorometric test tube ( Aşkun et al., 2010).
Colds, antibacterial( Aşkun et al., 2010, Soliman and Badeaa, 2002).
At 100 μg/ml, the ethanol extract of plant showed activity against M. tuberculosis H37Ra ( Tosun et al., 2004).

1)

The methanol extract showed activity against H37Ra at MIC 1568 μg/mL by MGIT fluorometric test tube ( Askun et al., 2009a).
The plant oil extract showed activity against H37RV and MTB sensitive isolates at MIC 640 μg /ml and observed 76.2% inhibition percentage ( Hozoorbakhsh et al., 2016).
Antiseptic, antibacterial. ( Beikmohammadi, 2012, Nezhadali et al., 2009).
At 0.39 mg/ml, the ethanol extract showed activity against M. bovis ( Maham et al., 2011).
The extract was active against M. bovis at 100 mg/ml ( Maham et al., 2011).
The methanol extract exhibited activity against H37Rv at 640 μg/mL concentration ( Asghari et al., 2015).
Anti-spasmodic, analgesic, anti-parasite ( Golshani et al., 2004, Saeidnia et al., 2005)
Ethanol extract of plant powder showed activity against M. bovis at 250 μg/ml ( Rahgozar et al., 2018).
The extract at concentration 187.5 μg/ml, was active against M. bovis ( Rahgozar et al., 2018).
The plant extract showed activity against M. bovis at 500.0 μg/ml ( Rahgozar et al., 2018).
Antibacterial, antifungal ( Millezi et al., 2012, Pourazar Dizaji et al., 2018).
The essential oil showed strong activity against clinical isolate M. tuberculosis and H37Rv stander strain at below 40 μg/ml ( Pourazar Dizaji et al., 2018).
Antibacterial, antifungal ( Millezi et al., 2012, Pourazar Dizaji et al., 2018).
Aqueous extract of plant inhibit mycobacterium growth activity at 1 mg/mL concentration by time kill 95% in 1 week ( Arjomandzadegan et al., 2016).

Aerial part: maceration by petroleum ether, ethyl acetate, methanol and fraction:
1)
Rosmarinic acid
2)
Caffeic acid

The petroleum ether fraction was active against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra with MIC of 12.5 and 50 μg/ml concentration respectively. The ethyl acetate fractions showed activity against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra with MIC of 12.5 μg/ml concentration. The MBC value of 50–800 μg/ml ( Askun et al., 2013).

Aerial part: maceration by petroleum ether, ethyl acetate, methanol and fraction:
1)
Rosmarinic acid
2)
Naringenin
3)
Hesperidin
4)
Luteolin
5)
Caffeic acid

The petroleum ether fraction was active against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra with MIC of 25 and 50 μg/ml concentration respectively. The ethyl acetate fractions showed activity against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra with MIC of 12.5 μg/ml concentration. The MBC value of 50–100 μg/ml against four tested organism ( Askun et al., 2013).
Antifungal, antibacterial ( Askun et al., 2008, De Oliveira et al., 2011).

The ethyl acetate fractions was active against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra with MIC of 100 and 50 μg/ml concentration respectively ( Askun et al., 2013).
Tonsillitis and common cold ( Askun et al., 2013).
Aerial part: maceration by petroleum ether, ethyl acetate, methanol and fraction
The petroleum ether fraction showed activity against M. tuberculosis H37Rv and H37Ra with MIC of 200 and 400 μg/ml concentration respectively. The MBC value of 800 μg/ml ( Askun et al., 2013).

Leaves, young stems, and flowers: hydrodistillation process
1)
Trans-caryophyllene
2)
β-phellandrene
3)
α-pinene

The oil extracted from leaves and young stems parts showed activity. The flowers oils separately with all active compound exhibited clear anti-TB activities with values >1.5 μg/ml MTB antigen ( Elmaidomy et al., 2017).
Coughs, abdominal pains, fever ( Elmaidomy et al., 2017, Lirio et al., 2014).
Leaves: Fractionation with water, n-hexane, chloroform, ethanol, ethyl acetate and n-butane.
The fractions extract of plant by n-hexane and chloroform was active against MTB H37Ra at 6.25 μg/ml ( Abuzeid et al., 2014).
Methanol extract showed activity against M. phlei M. smegmatis with MIC 25 and 25 mg/ml & DIZ 18.5 and 19 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The ethanol plant extract showed activity at 200 mg/ml against growth MTB and 18 colonies in 4 week incubation time ( Abbas, 2011).
At 100 μg/ml, the leaves ethanol extract showed 57% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Leaves: maceration by ethanol extracts 70%, fractionation by with petroleum ether, chloroform, methanol and water/ jervine

The plant extraction showed activity against H37Rv at concentrations 100 μg/ml with 95% Inhibition of growth The chloroform fractions and isolated bioactive compound is jervine have been tested against M. tuberculosis H37Rv showed activity with MIC value 50 and 25 μg/ml, respectively. ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The crude extract showed activity at 0.2 ml/10 ml concentration against growth MTB and 25 colonies in 4 week incubation ( Abbas, 2011).
Ethanol extract of the leaves showed 3% inhibition of growth against H37Rv at 100 μg/ml ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The extract showed activity against H37Rv strain at 100 μg/ml with 77% inhibition ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 μg/ml, the leaves ethanol extract showed 22% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Bark: fractionation in water, n-hexane, chloroform, ethanol, ethyl acetate and n-butane.
The fractions extract by chloroform, ethanol, ethyl acetate and n-butane was active at 6.25 μg/ml against MTB H37Ra ( Abuzeid et al., 2014).
Leaf, bark and root: Sonication dichloromethane, ethyl acetate and ethanol (10 mg/ml)
The plant parts extract showed activity with (MIC) values against Mycobacterium aurum at different concentration ( Eldeen and Van Staden, 2008).
The extract at concentration of 100 μg/ml showed 1% inhibition against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Asthma and cough ( Badgujar et al., 2014).
At 100 μg/ml, the leaves ethanol extract showed 66% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The ethanol extract was active against growth of H37Rv at concentrations 100 μg/ml with 5% inhibition ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The oils extract showed activity at 15 μl/ml against nine clinical isolates and H37Rv of tuberculosis ( Elhassan et al., 2017).
Antifungal ( Fathi and Shakarami, 2014, Katooli et al., 2011).
Ethanol extract of both leaves and flower at 100 μg/ml showed 24% Inhibition growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 μg/ml, the leaves ethanol extract showed 13% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The ethanol of plant extract exhibited 7% inhibition against H37Rv at concentrations 100 μg/ml ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Extracts showed activity against the M. phlei M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv with MIC 62.5, 25 and 125 mg/ml with DIZ 18.5, 20 and 11 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The plant extract was active against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
At 100 μg/ml, the ethanol extract showed 7% Inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Aerial: ethanol extracts 70% and fraction with petroleum ether, chloroform, methanol and water
The plant extract and fraction inhibited the growth at 50 μg/ml MIC against M. tuberculosis H37Ra ( Tosun et al., 2004).
Bark, root: Sonication dichloromethane, ethyl acetate and ethanol (10 mg/ml)
The plant parts extract exhibited result with (MIC) values against Mycobacterium aurum A + Bark extract 1.56, 1.56 & 0.39 mg/ml Root extract 0.39, 12.5 &6.25 mg/ml ( Eldeen and Van Staden, 2008).
Wood: ethanol extracts 70% Cones: ethanol extracts 70%
At 100 μg/ml, the ethanol extract of both wood and cones showed 96% and 26% inhibition of growth against H37Rv, respectively ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Oleoresin: ethanol extracts 70% and fraction with petroleum ether, chloroform, methanol and water
The plant extraction and fraction by petroleum ether showed inhibited growth at 50 μg/ml MIC against M. tuberculosis H37Ra ( Tosun et al., 2004).
The petroleum ether extract of the plant inhibited the growth of M. tuberculosis at concentration of 50 μg/ml ( Tosun et al., 2004)
At 200 mg/ml concentration plant extract showed activity against growth MTB and 15 colonies in 4 week incubation ( Abbas, 2011).
The methanol extracts of fruits exhibited activity against the M. phlei and M. tuberculosis H37Rv at MIC 50 and 31.3 mg/ml with DIZ 25 and 11 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
Ethanol extract showed activity at 200 mg/ml concentration against growth MTB and 4 colonies in 4 week incubation ( Abbas, 2011).

The essential oils extract showed Anti-TB activity at 15 μl/ml against nine clinical isolated M. tuberculosis strains and H37Rv ( Elhassan et al., 2016).
The essential oils extract showed Anti-TB activity at 15 μl/ml against nine clinical isolated M. tuberculosis strains and H37Rv ( Elhassan et al., 2016).
Methanol plant extract was active against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).

Primula vulgaris Huds. subsp. sibthorpii(Hoffmanns.) W. W. Sm. et Forrest
At 100 μg/ml, the ethanol extract of both leaves and flower showed 41% inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Potential activity against all M. tuberculosisisolates & H37RV with mean inhibitory zone of 18.8 mm at 200 mg/ml ( Jahanpour et al., 2015).
Anti-bacterial cold, flu ( Ghaemi et al., 2011, Jahanpour et al., 2015).
Peel: hydro-alcoholic extracts by cold percolation method
The plant extract showed best effect against M. bovis strain at 4 mg/ml with 32 mm inhibition zone ( Ghaemi et al., 2011).
At 100 μg/ml, the ethanol extract of both leaves and flower showed 36% inhibition of growth against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Exhibited activity of plant extract against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
Extracts methanol plant showed activity against M. phlei at MIC 80 mg/ml & DIZ 25 mm ( Safwat et al., 2018).
The oils extract exhibited anti-TB at 15 μl/ml against nine clinical isolates and H37Rv of tuberculosis ( Elhassan et al., 2017).
Cough, asthma & cold ( Hussain and Hussain, 2016).
Leaf, Bark: Sonication dichloromethane,ethyl acetate and ethanol (10 mg/ml)
The plant parts extract showed result with (MIC) values against Mycobacterium aurum A + Leaf extract 12.5, 12.5 & 6.25 mg/ml Bark extract 25, 6.25 & 0.39 mg/ml ( Eldeen and Van Staden, 2008).
Powder, fresh juice: maceration method by 70% ethanol
Moderate inhibitory activity only against sensitive (non MDR; non multi drug resistant) strains of M. tuberculosis ( Jahanpour et al., 2015) .
Powder: hydro-alcoholic extracts by cold percolation method
The plant extract showed best activity against M. smegmatis strain at 4 mg/ml with 27 mm inhibition zone ( Ghaemi et al., 2011).
Ethanol extract showed activity against H37Rv at concentrations 100 μg/ml with 24% inhibition ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The plant extract was active against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
Methanol plant extract showed activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg/ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).
At 100 μg/ml, the extract of plant showed 11% Inhibition against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Mixture of argan oil: 1.5% H2O at six different concentrations.
Concentration mixture 2.5: 7.5 and 3:7 exhibited good inhibitory effect against 17 MTB clinical isolated with percentage 64.71–82.35% ( AL-Saffar and Al-Dahmoshi, 2015).
Mixture of argan oil 100% and sider extract 62.5 g\L at eight different concentrations
The mixture showed good inhibitory effect against 10 MTB clinical isolated at all different concentration during 28 days incubation time (Prof. Dr. Habeeb Sahib Naher1*, 2014).
Ethanol extract of plant was active against five isolates MDR & non MDR M.tuberculosis ( Jahanpour et al., 2015).

1)
Cryptophilic acid C
2)
Chlorogenic acid
The purified compound showed marginal significant activity against H37Rv strain with 45% and 37% inhibition at MICs 100 μg /ml ( Tasdemir et al., 2008).
The plant extract showed activity against H37Rv at concentrations 100 μg /ml with 2% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The crude extract was active against M. bovis at 375.0 μg/ml ( Rahgozar et al., 2018).
The extract at 100 μg /ml exhibited 8% inhibition against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The plant ethanol extract was active against H37Rv at concentrations 100 μg /ml with 57% Inhibition of growth ( Tosun et al., 2005).
Methanol extract exhibited activity against the M. phlei M. smegmatis and M. tuberculosis H37Rv with MIC 40, 40 and 62.5 mg/ml with DIZ 22, 20 and10 mm, respectively ( Safwat et al., 2018).
Leaves: ethanol extracts 70% and fraction with petroleum ether, chloroform, methanol and water
The plant extraction and fraction by petroleum ether show inhibited growth at 50 μg/ml MIC against M. tuberculosis H37Ra ( Tosun et al., 2004).
Aerial: ethanol extracts 70% and fraction with petroleum ether, chloroform, methanol and water
The plant extraction and fraction by petroleum ether exhibited anti-TB activity against M. tuberculosis H37Ra at 50 μg/ml MIC ( Tosun et al., 2004).

whole plant: maceration by ethanol extracts 70%, fractionation by with petroleum ether, chloroform, methanol and water/
1)
Usnic acid

Ethanol extract of whole plant exhibited activity against H37Rv at 100 μg /ml. The fraction and isolated compound usnic acid as major compound inhibited M. tuberculosis H37Rv with Minimum inhibitory concentrations (MICs) at 12.5 µg/ml ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The ethanol extracts of both leaves and fruit exhibited Inhibition of growth against H37Rv at 100 μg /ml ( Tosun et al., 2005).
At 100 μg/ml, the extract of plant showed 73% Inhibition against H37Rv ( Tosun et al., 2005).
The methanol plant extract of plant showed activity against M. bovis BCG at MIC > 500 μg /ml ( Abou El Seoud et al., 2003).

Potential activity against all M. tuberculosis isolates & H37RV with mean inhibitory zone of 18.7 mm at 200 mg/ml ( Jahanpour et al., 2015). Mean of inhibitory zone was 18.7 ± 3.5 mm at concentration of 200 mg/ml of extract against all M. tuberculosis isolates & H37RV. TNF-α decrease in production after extract added in human macrophage cell line U937 with infected by H37Rv strain ( Davoodi et al., 2015).
